parameters.content:
## x402 Payment Endpoint 

This workflow lets you monetize inference on private models hosted with Ollama in n8n. The x402 payment scheme lets user agents pass payments in the x-payment header field. 

Learn more about the [x402 payment](https://www.x402.org/) protocol. 

Watch the [YouTube tutorial](https://youtu.be/m3ThthLtj3g) video.

## Any ERC-20 on any EVM

With the 1Shot API node, you can accept any ERC-20 with the appropriate `transferWithAuthorization` methods.

## x402 + Ollama Inference

Set up the LLM block to point at your Ollama inference engine. This will let you charge for agents to request queries to your private models.

## Example Curl Command

You can test the webhook endpoint with a command like this (be sure to use a properly formatted x-payment header payload): 

```sh
# swap out the URL here for you webhook URL endpoint
curl -X POST \
  https://n8n.1shotapi.dev/webhook-test/92c5ca23-99a7-437d-85da-84aef8bd2a25 \
  -H "x-payment: YOUR-BASE64-ENCODED-PAYMENT-PAYLOAD" \
  -H "User-Agent: CustomUserAgent/1.0" \
  -H "Accept: application/json" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{
    "query": "What is the capital of France?"
  }'
```

## Ensure Required Payment Details

Use this block to add/check for payment detail requirements like minimum payment amount. 

You might also want to add a condition in the block to ensure payments are sent to the correct address.

## Ollama + ngrok Docker stack

This example assumes your n8n session is hosted separately from your Ollama instance. You can use ngrok to create a secure tunnel between your n8n workflow and your Ollama instance

1. Create a free account at ngrok.com.
2. Generate a free static URL under the Domains tab.
3. Grab your ngrok auth token 
4. Spin up an Ollama + ngrok stack so that n8n can reach your private Ollama model: 

sudo NGROK_AUTHTOKEN=... TUNNEL_BASE_URL=https://your-static-url.ngrok-free.app docker compose up -d

Here is your docker-compose.yaml: 

```sh
services:
  ngrok:
    image: ngrok/ngrok:latest
    container_name: ngrok
    command:
      - "http"
      - "http://ollama:11434"
      - "--url=${TUNNEL_BASE_URL}"
    environment:
      NGROK_AUTHTOKEN: ${NGROK_AUTHTOKEN}
      TUNNEL_BASE_URL: ${TUNNEL_BASE_URL}
    ports:
      - 4040:4040

  ollama-service:
    image: ollama/ollama:latest
    container_name: ollama
    volumes:
      - ./ollama-volume:/root/.ollama
    ports:
      - "1337:11434"
    deploy:
      resources:
        reservations:
          devices:
            - driver: nvidia
              count: 1
              capabilities: [gpu]
```
